🧱 1. Overview

Project Name

evmeri - Electric Vehicle Charging Station Locator for Ethiopia

Description

evmeri is a comprehensive mobile and web application designed to help electric vehicle owners in Ethiopia locate, navigate to, and manage charging sessions at EV charging stations. The platform provides real-time station availability, payment integration, and station management tools for both users and station owners.

Purpose & Goals

  • Primary Goal: Accelerate EV adoption in Ethiopia by providing reliable charging infrastructure information
  • User Experience: Simplify the process of finding and using EV charging stations
  • Station Management: Provide tools for charging station owners to manage their infrastructure
  • Payment Integration: Enable seamless payment processing for charging sessions
  • Localization: Support for Ethiopian users with local payment methods and languages

Key Features

  • 🗺️ Interactive Map: Real-time charging station locations using OpenStreetMap
  • 📱 Mobile App: Native Flutter application for iOS and Android
  • 🌐 Web Dashboard: Station owner management portal
  • 💳 Payment Integration: Chapa payment gateway for Ethiopian market
  • 🔍 Station Search: Find stations by location, connector type, and availability
  • ⭐ Reviews & Ratings: User feedback system for stations
  • 🚗 Navigation: Turn-by-turn directions to charging stations
  • 📊 Analytics: Usage statistics and charging history
  • 🔐 Authentication: Secure user registration and login
  • 📧 Email Verification: Account verification system
  • 🏪 Station Management: Tools for station owners to manage their infrastructure

🗺 2. Architecture

System Architecture Diagram

┌─────────────────┐ ┌─────────────────┐ ┌─────────────────┐ │ Mobile App │ │ Web Frontend │ │ Admin Panel │ │ (Flutter) │ │ (React/JSX) │ │ (Django) │ └─────────┬───────┘ └─────────┬───────┘ └─────────┬───────┘ │ │ │ └──────────────────────┼──────────────────────┘ │ ┌─────────────┴─────────────┐ │ API Gateway │ │ (Django REST API) │ └─────────────┬─────────────┘ │ ┌───────────────────────┼───────────────────────┐ │ │ │ ┌─────┴─────┐ ┌───────┴───────┐ ┌───────┴───────┐ │ Database │ │ External │ │ Payment │ │(PostgreSQL│ │ Services │ │ Gateway │ │/SQLite) │ │ │ │ (Chapa) │ └───────────┘ └───────────────┘ └───────────────┘ │ ┌───────┴───────┐ │ OpenStreetMap │ │ Email SMTP │ │ File Storage│ └───────────────┘

Technology Stack

Frontend

  • Mobile: Flutter 3.x (Dart)
  • Web: React 18+ with JSX
  • State Management: Provider (Flutter), React Hooks (Web)
  • Navigation: Flutter Navigator 2.0, React Router
  • Maps: OpenStreetMap with flutter_map
  • HTTP Client: http package (Flutter), fetch API (Web)

Backend

  • Framework: Django 4.x with Django REST Framework
  • Database: PostgreSQL (Production), SQLite (Development)
  • Authentication: Django Token Authentication
  • API Documentation: Django REST Framework Browsable API
  • File Storage: Django File Storage
  • Email: SMTP with Gmail integration

External Services

  • Maps: OpenStreetMap (Nominatim for geocoding)
  • Payments: Chapa Payment Gateway
  • Email: Gmail SMTP
  • Hosting: Render.com (Backend), Vercel (Frontend)

Development Tools

  • Version Control: Git
  • IDE: VS Code, Android Studio
  • Testing: Flutter Test, Jest (Web)
  • CI/CD: GitHub Actions
  • Package Management: pub (Flutter), npm (Web), pip (Python)

Component Architecture

Frontend Components

  • Mobile App (Flutter): Cross-platform mobile application
  • Web Frontend (React): Station owner dashboard and public website
  • Admin Panel (Django): System administration interface

Backend Services

  • API Gateway: Django REST Framework handling all API requests
  • Database: PostgreSQL for production, SQLite for development
  • Authentication: Token-based authentication system
  • File Storage: Django file storage for images and documents

External Integrations

  • Payment Gateway: Chapa for Ethiopian payment processing
  • Maps Service: OpenStreetMap with Nominatim geocoding
  • Email Service: SMTP integration for notifications
  • Push Notifications: Firebase Cloud Messaging

Data Flow

User Registration Flow

Mobile App → API Gateway → Database → Email Service
    ↓
User receives verification email
    ↓
Email verification → Account activation

Station Discovery Flow

Mobile App → Location Services → API Gateway → Database
    ↓
Filter by location/preferences
    ↓
Return nearby stations with real-time data

Payment Processing Flow

QR Code Scan → Payment Initiation → Chapa Gateway
    ↓
Payment Confirmation → Charging Session Start
    ↓
Real-time Updates → Session Completion → Receipt

⚙️ 3. Installation & Setup

Prerequisites

System Requirements

  • Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04+ / macOS 10.15+ / Windows 10+
  • RAM: 8GB minimum, 16GB recommended
  • Storage: 20GB free space
  • Internet: Stable broadband connection

Required Software

Backend Development:
- Python 3.9+
- Node.js 16+
- PostgreSQL 13+
- Git

Mobile Development:
- Flutter SDK 3.0+
- Android Studio / Xcode
- Android SDK / iOS SDK

Web Development:
- Node.js 16+
- npm or yarn
- Modern web browser

Backend Setup

1. Clone Repository

git clone https://github.com/your-username/evmeri-backend.git
cd evmeri-backend

2. Create Virtual Environment

# Using venv
python3 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate

# Using conda
conda create -n evmeri python=3.9
conda activate evmeri

3. Install Dependencies

pip install -r requirements.txt

4. Database Setup

# Install PostgreSQL (Ubuntu)
sudo apt update
sudo apt install postgresql postgresql-contrib

# Create database
sudo -u postgres createdb evmeri_db
sudo -u postgres createuser evmeri_user
sudo -u postgres psql -c "ALTER USER evmeri_user PASSWORD 'your_password';"
sudo -u postgres psql -c "GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON DATABASE evmeri_db TO evmeri_user;"

5. Environment Configuration

# Create .env file
cp .env.example .env

# Edit .env with your settings
DATABASE_URL=postgresql://evmeri_user:your_password@localhost/evmeri_db
SECRET_KEY=your_secret_key_here
DEBUG=True
CHAPA_SECRET_KEY=your_chapa_secret_key
EMAIL_HOST_PASSWORD=your_email_password

6. Run Migrations

python manage.py makemigrations
python manage.py migrate

7. Create Superuser

python manage.py createsuperuser

8. Start Development Server

python manage.py runserver

Mobile App Setup

1. Install Flutter

# Download Flutter SDK
git clone https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git -b stable
export PATH="$PATH:`pwd`/flutter/bin"

# Verify installation
flutter doctor

2. Clone Mobile Repository

git clone https://github.com/your-username/evmeri-mobile.git
cd evmeri-mobile

3. Install Dependencies

flutter pub get

4. Configure API Endpoint

# Edit lib/config/api_config.dart
class ApiConfig {
  static const String baseUrl = 'http://localhost:8000/api';
  static const String chapaPublicKey = 'your_chapa_public_key';
}

5. Run Mobile App

# For Android
flutter run

# For iOS (macOS only)
flutter run -d ios

Web Frontend Setup

1. Clone Web Repository

git clone https://github.com/your-username/evmeri-web.git
cd evmeri-web

2. Install Dependencies

npm install
# or
yarn install

3. Configure Environment

# Create .env.local
REACT_APP_API_URL=http://localhost:8000/api
REACT_APP_CHAPA_PUBLIC_KEY=your_chapa_public_key

4. Start Development Server

npm start
# or
yarn start

Docker Setup (Alternative)

1. Using Docker Compose

# Clone main repository
git clone https://github.com/your-username/evmeri.git
cd evmeri

# Start all services
docker-compose up -d

# View logs
docker-compose logs -f

2. Docker Compose Configuration

version: '3.8'
services:
  db:
    image: postgres:13
    environment:
      POSTGRES_DB: evmeri_db
      POSTGRES_USER: evmeri_user
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: password
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data

  backend:
    build: ./backend
    ports:
      - "8000:8000"
    depends_on:
      - db
    environment:
      - DATABASE_URL=postgresql://evmeri_user:password@db/evmeri_db

  frontend:
    build: ./web_frontend
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    depends_on:
      - backend

volumes:
  postgres_data:

🔧 4. Environment Configuration

Backend Environment Variables

Core Settings

# .env file for Django backend
DEBUG=True
SECRET_KEY=your-secret-key-here
ALLOWED_HOSTS=localhost,127.0.0.1,your-domain.com

# Database Configuration
DATABASE_URL=postgresql://user:password@localhost/evmeri_db

# Email Configuration
EMAIL_BACKEND=django.core.mail.backends.smtp.EmailBackend
EMAIL_HOST=smtp.gmail.com
EMAIL_PORT=587
EMAIL_USE_TLS=True
EMAIL_HOST_USER=your-email@gmail.com
EMAIL_HOST_PASSWORD=your-app-password

# Chapa Payment Configuration
CHAPA_SECRET_KEY=your-chapa-secret-key
CHAPA_PUBLIC_KEY=your-chapa-public-key
CHAPA_RETURN_URL=http://localhost:3000/payment/callback

# File Storage
MEDIA_URL=/media/
MEDIA_ROOT=media/
STATIC_URL=/static/
STATIC_ROOT=staticfiles/

# Security Settings
CORS_ALLOWED_ORIGINS=http://localhost:3000,http://127.0.0.1:3000
CSRF_TRUSTED_ORIGINS=http://localhost:3000,http://127.0.0.1:3000

Mobile App Configuration

API Configuration

// lib/config/api_config.dart
class ApiConfig {
  static const String baseUrl = 'https://your-api-domain.com/api';
  static const String chapaPublicKey = 'CHAPA_PUBLIC_KEY';
  static const int timeoutDuration = 30; // seconds

  // Development vs Production
  static const bool isProduction = bool.fromEnvironment('dart.vm.product');

  static String get apiUrl {
    return isProduction
      ? 'https://api.evmeri.com/api'
      : 'http://localhost:8000/api';
  }
}

Firebase Configuration

// android/app/google-services.json (for Android)
// ios/Runner/GoogleService-Info.plist (for iOS)

// lib/config/firebase_config.dart
class FirebaseConfig {
  static const String projectId = 'evmeri-app';
  static const String messagingSenderId = 'your-sender-id';
  static const String appId = 'your-app-id';
}

Web Frontend Configuration

Environment Variables

# .env.local for React app
REACT_APP_API_URL=http://localhost:8000/api

REACT_APP_FIREBASE_API_KEY=your-firebase-api-key
REACT_APP_FIREBASE_PROJECT_ID=evmeri-web

# Production settings
REACT_APP_ENVIRONMENT=development
REACT_APP_VERSION=1.0.0

🧩 5. Modules & Features

Authentication Module

Backend Implementation

Location: authentication/

Key Files:

  • models.py - Custom User model with additional fields
  • views.py - Registration, login, verification views
  • serializers.py - API serializers for user data
  • urls.py - Authentication endpoint routing

Features:

  • User registration with email verification
  • Token-based authentication
  • Password reset functionality
  • Profile management
  • Social authentication support

API Endpoints

POST /api/auth/register/          # User registration
POST /api/auth/login/             # User login
POST /api/auth/verify-email/      # Email verification
POST /api/auth/forgot-password/   # Password reset request
POST /api/auth/reset-password/    # Password reset confirmation
POST /api/auth/logout/            # User logout
GET  /api/auth/profile/           # User profile
PUT  /api/auth/profile/           # Update profile

Mobile App Integration

Location: mobile_frontend/lib/services/auth_service.dart

class AuthService {
  static Future login(String email, String password) async {
    final response = await http.post(
      Uri.parse('${ApiConfig.baseUrl}/auth/login/'),
      headers: {'Content-Type': 'application/json'},
      body: jsonEncode({
        'email': email,
        'password': password,
      }),
    );

    if (response.statusCode == 200) {
      final data = jsonDecode(response.body);
      await _saveToken(data['token']);
      return User.fromJson(data['user']);
    }
    return null;
  }
}

Charging Station Management

Backend Models

Location: charging_stations/models.py

class ChargingStation(models.Model):
    name = models.CharField(max_length=200)
    description = models.TextField(blank=True)
    address = models.CharField(max_length=500)
    latitude = models.DecimalField(max_digits=9, decimal_places=6)
    longitude = models.DecimalField(max_digits=9, decimal_places=6)
    status = models.CharField(max_length=20, choices=STATUS_CHOICES)
    owner = models.ForeignKey(User, on_delete=models.CASCADE)
    amenities = models.ManyToManyField(Amenity, blank=True)
    rating = models.DecimalField(max_digits=3, decimal_places=2, default=0)
    rating_count = models.IntegerField(default=0)
    created_at = models.DateTimeField(auto_now_add=True)

class ChargingConnector(models.Model):
    station = models.ForeignKey(ChargingStation, on_delete=models.CASCADE)
    connector_type = models.CharField(max_length=50)
    power_kw = models.DecimalField(max_digits=5, decimal_places=2)
    status = models.CharField(max_length=20, choices=CONNECTOR_STATUS_CHOICES)
    price_per_kwh = models.DecimalField(max_digits=6, decimal_places=2)

Station Discovery API

class NearbyStationsView(APIView):
    def get(self, request):
        lat = float(request.GET.get('lat'))
        lng = float(request.GET.get('lng'))
        radius = float(request.GET.get('radius', 10))

        # Calculate distance using Haversine formula
        stations = ChargingStation.objects.filter(
            latitude__range=(lat - radius/111, lat + radius/111),
            longitude__range=(lng - radius/111, lng + radius/111),
            status='operational'
        ).annotate(
            distance=Distance(
                Point(lng, lat, srid=4326),
                Point('longitude', 'latitude', srid=4326)
            )
        ).order_by('distance')

        serializer = StationSerializer(stations, many=True)
        return Response({'results': serializer.data})

Payment System Module

Chapa Integration

Location: payments/

Features:

  • QR code payment initiation
  • Real-time payment status tracking
  • Transaction history
  • Refund processing
  • Multiple payment methods (Mobile Money, Bank Transfer)

Payment Flow Implementation

class QRPaymentInitiationView(APIView):
    def post(self, request):
        connector_id = request.data.get('connector_id')
        amount = request.data.get('amount')
        phone_number = request.data.get('phone_number')

        # Create QR session
        qr_session = QRSession.objects.create(
            user=request.user,
            connector_id=connector_id,
            amount=amount,
            status='pending'
        )

        # Initialize Chapa payment
        payment_data = {
            'amount': amount,
            'currency': 'ETB',
            'email': request.user.email,
            'phone_number': phone_number,
            'tx_ref': f'evmeri-{qr_session.id}',
            'return_url': settings.CHAPA_RETURN_URL,
        }

        chapa_response = chapa_client.initialize_payment(payment_data)

        return Response({
            'session_token': qr_session.session_token,
            'payment_url': chapa_response['data']['checkout_url'],
            'qr_session': QRSessionSerializer(qr_session).data
        })

Map Integration Module

OpenStreetMap Implementation

Location: mobile_frontend/lib/screens/map_screen.dart

class MapScreen extends StatefulWidget {
  @override
  _MapScreenState createState() => _MapScreenState();
}

class _MapScreenState extends State {
  MapController mapController = MapController();
  List stationMarkers = [];
  LatLng? currentLocation;

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      body: FlutterMap(
        mapController: mapController,
        options: MapOptions(
          center: currentLocation ?? LatLng(9.0320, 38.7469),
          zoom: 13.0,
          onMapReady: _onMapReady,
        ),
        children: [
          TileLayer(
            urlTemplate: 'https://tile.openstreetmap.org/{z}/{x}/{y}.png',
            userAgentPackageName: 'com.evmeri.app',
          ),
          MarkerLayer(markers: stationMarkers),
          CurrentLocationLayer(),
        ],
      ),
      floatingActionButton: FloatingActionButton(
        onPressed: _centerOnCurrentLocation,
        child: Icon(Icons.my_location),
      ),
    );
  }
}

Navigation Module

Turn-by-Turn Navigation

Features:

  • Real-time GPS tracking
  • Voice guidance in multiple languages
  • Route optimization for EVs
  • Traffic-aware routing
  • Offline map support
class NavigationService {
  static Future calculateRoute(
    LatLng start,
    LatLng destination,
    {RoutePreference preference = RoutePreference.fastest}
  ) async {
    final response = await http.get(
      Uri.parse('https://router.project-osrm.org/route/v1/driving/'
        '${start.longitude},${start.latitude};'
        '${destination.longitude},${destination.latitude}'
        '?overview=full&geometries=geojson&steps=true'),
    );

    if (response.statusCode == 200) {
      final data = jsonDecode(response.body);
      return Route.fromOSRM(data['routes'][0]);
    }
    throw Exception('Failed to calculate route');
  }
}

Notification System

Push Notifications

Technologies:

  • Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) for mobile
  • Web Push API for web notifications
  • Email notifications for important updates

Implementation:

class NotificationService {
  static FirebaseMessaging messaging = FirebaseMessaging.instance;

  static Future initialize() async {
    NotificationSettings settings = await messaging.requestPermission(
      alert: true,
      badge: true,
      sound: true,
    );

    FirebaseMessaging.onMessage.listen((RemoteMessage message) {
      _showLocalNotification(message);
    });

    FirebaseMessaging.onMessageOpenedApp.listen((RemoteMessage message) {
      _handleNotificationTap(message);
    });
  }

  static Future subscribeToTopic(String topic) async {
    await messaging.subscribeToTopic(topic);
  }
}

🧾 6. API Documentation

Base Configuration

  • Base URL: https://mengedmate.onrender.com/api
  • Authentication: Token-based authentication
  • Content Type: application/json
  • API Version: v1

Authentication Headers

Authorization: Token your_token_here
Content-Type: application/json

Authentication Endpoints

User Registration

POST /api/auth/register/
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "email": "user@example.com",
  "password1": "securepassword123",
  "password2": "securepassword123",
  "first_name": "John",
  "last_name": "Doe"
}

Response (201):
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Registration successful. Please verify your email.",
  "user": {
    "id": "uuid",
    "email": "user@example.com",
    "first_name": "John",
    "last_name": "Doe"
  }
}

User Login

POST /api/auth/login/
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "email": "user@example.com",
  "password": "securepassword123"
}

Response (200):
{
  "success": true,
  "token": "your_auth_token_here",
  "user": {
    "id": "uuid",
    "email": "user@example.com",
    "first_name": "John",
    "last_name": "Doe",
    "is_verified": true
  }
}

Station Endpoints

Get Nearby Stations

GET /api/public/nearby-stations/?lat=9.0320&lng=38.7469&radius=10

Response (200):
{
  "success": true,
  "results": [
    {
      "id": "station_uuid",
      "name": "EVMERI Station 1",
      "address": "Addis Ababa, Ethiopia",
      "latitude": 9.0320,
      "longitude": 38.7469,
      "distance": 2.5,
      "status": "operational",
      "connectors": [
        {
          "id": "connector_uuid",
          "connector_type": "Type 2",
          "power_kw": 22.0,
          "status": "available",
          "price_per_kwh": 6.0
        }
      ],
      "amenities": ["parking", "restroom", "wifi"],
      "rating": 4.5,
      "rating_count": 128
    }
  ],
  "count": 1
}

Get Station Details

GET /api/stations/{station_id}/
Authorization: Token your_token_here

Response (200):
{
  "id": "station_uuid",
  "name": "EVMERI Station 1",
  "description": "Fast charging station in city center",
  "address": "Addis Ababa, Ethiopia",
  "latitude": 9.0320,
  "longitude": 38.7469,
  "status": "operational",
  "owner": {
    "company_name": "EVMERI Inc",
    "contact_email": "mengedmate@gmail.com"
  },
  "connectors": [...],
  "amenities": [...],
  "operating_hours": {
    "monday": "00:00-23:59",
    "tuesday": "00:00-23:59"
  },
  "images": [
    {
      "id": "image_uuid",
      "image_url": "https://example.com/station1.jpg",
      "is_main": true
    }
  ],
  "rating": 4.5,
  "rating_count": 128
}

Payment Endpoints

Initiate QR Payment

POST /api/payments/qr-sessions/
Authorization: Token your_token_here
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "connector_id": "connector_uuid",
  "payment_type": "amount",
  "amount": 100.00,
  "phone_number": "+251900123456"
}

Response (201):
{
  "success": true,
  "session_token": "unique_session_token",
  "payment_url": "https://checkout.chapa.co/checkout/payment/...",
  "qr_session": {
    "id": "session_uuid",
    "amount": 100.00,
    "status": "pending",
    "expires_at": "2024-01-01T12:00:00Z"
  }
}

Error Responses

HTTP 400 Bad Request
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "Validation error",
  "details": {
    "email": ["This field is required."],
    "password": ["Password too short."]
  }
}

HTTP 401 Unauthorized
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "Authentication required",
  "message": "Please provide a valid authentication token."
}

HTTP 404 Not Found
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "Resource not found",
  "message": "The requested station does not exist."
}

Rate Limiting

  • Authenticated requests: 1000 requests per hour
  • Public endpoints: 100 requests per hour
  • Payment endpoints: 10 requests per minute

📱 7. UI/UX Design

Design System

Color Palette

  • Primary Blue: #2563eb - Main brand color
  • Secondary Blue: #3b82f6 - Accent color
  • Success Green: #10b981 - Success states
  • Warning Orange: #f59e0b - Warning states
  • Error Red: #ef4444 - Error states
  • Gray Scale: #f8fafc to #1f2937 - Text and backgrounds

Typography

  • Primary Font: Inter (Web), System Default (Mobile)
  • Headings: Bold weights (600-700)
  • Body Text: Regular weight (400)
  • Captions: Medium weight (500)

Spacing System

  • Base Unit: 4px
  • Scale: 4px, 8px, 12px, 16px, 20px, 24px, 32px, 40px, 48px, 64px

Mobile App Design

Navigation Structure

Main Screen (Bottom Navigation)
├── Home (Map View)
│   ├── Station Details
│   ├── Navigation Screen
│   └── QR Scanner
├── Stations (List View)
│   ├── Station Details
│   ├── Leave Review
│   └── Favorites Toggle
├── Favorites
│   └── Saved Stations
└── Settings
    ├── Profile
    ├── Charging History
    ├── Change Password
    ├── FAQs
    ├── Report Issue
    └── About evmeri

Key Screens

1. Home/Map Screen

  • Full-screen OpenStreetMap
  • Custom station markers with status colors
  • Floating search bar
  • Current location button
  • Nearby stations bottom sheet

2. Station Details Screen

  • Station image carousel
  • Real-time availability status
  • Connector information with pricing
  • Amenities list with icons
  • Reviews and ratings
  • Navigation and QR scan buttons

Custom Widgets

class StationMarker extends StatelessWidget {
  final Station station;
  final VoidCallback onTap;

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return GestureDetector(
      onTap: onTap,
      child: Container(
        width: 40,
        height: 40,
        decoration: BoxDecoration(
          color: _getStatusColor(station.status),
          shape: BoxShape.circle,
          border: Border.all(color: Colors.white, width: 2),
          boxShadow: [
            BoxShadow(
              color: Colors.black26,
              blurRadius: 4,
              offset: Offset(0, 2),
            ),
          ],
        ),
        child: Icon(
          Icons.ev_station,
          color: Colors.white,
          size: 20,
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}

Web Dashboard Design

Layout Structure

  • Header: Navigation, user menu, notifications
  • Sidebar: Main navigation menu
  • Main Content: Dashboard content area
  • Footer: Links and copyright information

Dashboard Components

  • Statistics Cards: Key metrics display
  • Charts: Usage analytics and trends
  • Data Tables: Station and transaction lists
  • Forms: Station management forms

    'default': dj_database_url.parse(os.environ.get('DATABASE_URL'))
}

Render.com Deployment

# render.yaml
services:
  - type: web
    name: evmeri-backend
    env: python
    buildCommand: pip install -r requirements.txt
    startCommand: gunicorn evmeri_backend.wsgi:application
    envVars:
      - key: DATABASE_URL
        fromDatabase:
          name: evmeri-db
          property: connectionString
      - key: SECRET_KEY
        generateValue: true
      - key: WEB_CONCURRENCY
        value: 4

databases:
  - name: evmeri-db
    databaseName: evmeri
    user: evmeri

      "config": {
        "distDir": "build"
      }
    }
  ],
  "routes": [
    {
      "src": "/static/(.*)",
      "headers": {
        "cache-control": "s-maxage=31536000,immutable"
      }
    },
    {
      "src": "/(.*)",
      "dest": "/index.html"
    }
  ]
}

CI/CD Pipeline

GitHub Actions

# .github/workflows/deploy.yml
name: Deploy to Production

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v2
        with:
          python-version: 3.9
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: pip install -r requirements.txt
      - name: Run tests
        run: python manage.py test

  deploy:
    needs: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Deploy to Render
        run: curl -X POST ${{ secrets.RENDER_DEPLOY_HOOK }}

🧪 10. Testing

Backend Testing

Unit Tests

# tests/test_authentication.py
from django.test import TestCase
from django.contrib.auth import get_user_model
from rest_framework.test import APIClient
from rest_framework import status

User = get_user_model()

class AuthenticationTestCase(TestCase):
    def setUp(self):
        self.client = APIClient()
        self.user_data = {
            'email': 'test@example.com',
            'password1': 'testpass123',
            'password2': 'testpass123',
            'first_name': 'Test',
            'last_name': 'User'
        }

    def test_user_registration(self):
        response = self.client.post('/api/auth/register/', self.user_data)
        self.assertEqual(response.status_code, status.HTTP_201_CREATED)
        self.assertTrue(User.objects.filter(email='test@example.com').exists())

    def test_user_login(self):
        user = User.objects.create_user(
            email='test@example.com',
            password='testpass123'
        )
        login_data = {
            'email': 'test@example.com',
            'password': 'testpass123'
        }
        response = self.client.post('/api/auth/login/', login_data)
        self.assertEqual(response.status_code, status.HTTP_200_OK)
        self.assertIn('token', response.data)

Integration Tests

# tests/test_stations.py
class StationAPITestCase(TestCase):
    def setUp(self):
        self.user = User.objects.create_user(
            email='owner@example.com',
            password='testpass123'
        )
        self.client = APIClient()
        self.client.force_authenticate(user=self.user)

    def test_create_station(self):
        station_data = {
            'name': 'Test Station',
            'address': 'Test Address',
            'latitude': 9.0320,
            'longitude': 38.7469,
            'status': 'operational'
        }
        response = self.client.post('/api/stations/', station_data)
        self.assertEqual(response.status_code, status.HTTP_201_CREATED)

    def test_nearby_stations(self):
        # Create test station
        ChargingStation.objects.create(
            name='Nearby Station',
            latitude=9.0320,
            longitude=38.7469,
            owner=self.user
        )

        response = self.client.get('/api/public/nearby-stations/?lat=9.0320&lng=38.7469&radius=10')
        self.assertEqual(response.status_code, status.HTTP_200_OK)
        self.assertEqual(len(response.data['results']), 1)

Running Tests

# Run all tests
python manage.py test

# Run specific app tests
python manage.py test authentication

# Run with coverage
coverage run --source='.' manage.py test
coverage report
coverage html

Mobile App Testing

Unit Tests

// test/services/auth_service_test.dart
import 'package:flutter_test/flutter_test.dart';
import 'package:mockito/mockito.dart';
import 'package:evmeri/services/auth_service.dart';

class MockHttpClient extends Mock implements HttpClient {}

void main() {
  group('AuthService Tests', () {
    late AuthService authService;
    late MockHttpClient mockHttpClient;

    setUp(() {
      mockHttpClient = MockHttpClient();
      authService = AuthService(httpClient: mockHttpClient);
    });

    test('should login user successfully', () async {
      // Arrange
      when(mockHttpClient.post(any, body: anyNamed('body')))
          .thenAnswer((_) async => MockResponse(200, '{"token": "test_token"}'));

      // Act
      final result = await authService.login('test@example.com', 'password');

      // Assert
      expect(result.isSuccess, true);
      expect(result.data['token'], 'test_token');
    });
  });
}

Widget Tests

// test/widgets/station_card_test.dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:flutter_test/flutter_test.dart';
import 'package:evmeri/widgets/station_card.dart';
import 'package:evmeri/models/station.dart';

void main() {
  testWidgets('StationCard displays station information', (WidgetTester tester) async {
    // Arrange
    final station = Station(
      id: '1',
      name: 'Test Station',
      address: 'Test Address',
      distance: 2.5,
      rating: 4.5,
    );

    // Act
    await tester.pumpWidget(
      MaterialApp(
        home: Scaffold(
          body: StationCard(station: station),
        ),
      ),
    );

    // Assert
    expect(find.text('Test Station'), findsOneWidget);
    expect(find.text('Test Address'), findsOneWidget);
    expect(find.text('2.5 km'), findsOneWidget);
  });
}

Integration Tests

// integration_test/app_test.dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:flutter_test/flutter_test.dart';
import 'package:integration_test/integration_test.dart';
import 'package:evmeri/main.dart' as app;

void main() {
  IntegrationTestWidgetsFlutterBinding.ensureInitialized();

  group('App Integration Tests', () {
    testWidgets('complete user flow', (WidgetTester tester) async {
      app.main();
      await tester.pumpAndSettle();

      // Test login flow
      await tester.tap(find.byKey(Key('login_button')));
      await tester.pumpAndSettle();

      await tester.enterText(find.byKey(Key('email_field')), 'test@example.com');
      await tester.enterText(find.byKey(Key('password_field')), 'password');

      await tester.tap(find.byKey(Key('submit_button')));
      await tester.pumpAndSettle();

      // Verify navigation to home screen
      expect(find.byKey(Key('home_screen')), findsOneWidget);
    });
  });
}

Web Frontend Testing

Jest Unit Tests

// src/services/__tests__/authService.test.js
import authService from '../authService';
import axios from 'axios';

jest.mock('axios');
const mockedAxios = axios as jest.Mocked;

describe('AuthService', () => {
  beforeEach(() => {
    jest.clearAllMocks();
  });

  test('should login user successfully', async () => {
    const mockResponse = {
      data: {
        success: true,
        token: 'test_token',
        user: { id: '1', email: 'test@example.com' }
      }
    };

    mockedAxios.post.mockResolvedValue(mockResponse);

    const result = await authService.login('test@example.com', 'password');

    expect(result.success).toBe(true);
    expect(result.token).toBe('test_token');
    expect(mockedAxios.post).toHaveBeenCalledWith('/api/auth/login/', {
      email: 'test@example.com',
      password: 'password'
    });
  });
});

React Testing Library

// src/components/__tests__/StationCard.test.jsx
import React from 'react';
import { render, screen, fireEvent } from '@testing-library/react';
import StationCard from '../StationCard';

const mockStation = {
  id: '1',
  name: 'Test Station',
  address: 'Test Address',
  distance: 2.5,
  rating: 4.5,
  connectors: [
    { type: 'Type 2', status: 'available', power: 22 }
  ]
};

describe('StationCard', () => {
  test('renders station information correctly', () => {
    render();

    expect(screen.getByText('Test Station')).toBeInTheDocument();
    expect(screen.getByText('Test Address')).toBeInTheDocument();
    expect(screen.getByText('2.5 km')).toBeInTheDocument();
    expect(screen.getByText('4.5')).toBeInTheDocument();
  });

  test('calls onNavigate when navigate button is clicked', () => {
    const mockOnNavigate = jest.fn();
    render();

    fireEvent.click(screen.getByText('Navigate'));
    expect(mockOnNavigate).toHaveBeenCalledWith(mockStation.id);
  });
});

🔐 11. Security

Authentication & Authorization

Token-Based Authentication

  • JWT Tokens: Secure token generation and validation
  • Token Expiration: Automatic token refresh mechanism
  • Secure Storage: Encrypted token storage on mobile devices
  • Session Management: Proper session handling and cleanup

Password Security

# Django password validation
AUTH_PASSWORD_VALIDATORS = [
    {
        'NAME': 'django.contrib.auth.password_validation.UserAttributeSimilarityValidator',
    },
    {
        'NAME': 'django.contrib.auth.password_validation.MinimumLengthValidator',
        'OPTIONS': {
            'min_length': 8,
        }
    },
    {
        'NAME': 'django.contrib.auth.password_validation.CommonPasswordValidator',
    },
    {
        'NAME': 'django.contrib.auth.password_validation.NumericPasswordValidator',
    },
]

# Password hashing
PASSWORD_HASHERS = [
    'django.contrib.auth.hashers.Argon2PasswordHasher',
    'django.contrib.auth.hashers.PBKDF2PasswordHasher',
]

Data Protection

Encryption

  • Data at Rest: Database encryption for sensitive data
  • Data in Transit: HTTPS/TLS encryption for all communications
  • API Security: Request/response encryption
  • File Storage: Encrypted file storage for user documents

Input Validation

# Django serializer validation
class StationSerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    class Meta:
        model = ChargingStation
        fields = '__all__'

    def validate_latitude(self, value):
        if not -90 <= value <= 90:
            raise serializers.ValidationError("Invalid latitude")
        return value

    def validate_longitude(self, value):
        if not -180 <= value <= 180:
            raise serializers.ValidationError("Invalid longitude")
        return value

API Security

Rate Limiting

# Django rate limiting
REST_FRAMEWORK = {
    'DEFAULT_THROTTLE_CLASSES': [
        'rest_framework.throttling.AnonRateThrottle',
        'rest_framework.throttling.UserRateThrottle'
    ],
    'DEFAULT_THROTTLE_RATES': {
        'anon': '100/hour',
        'user': '1000/hour',
        'payment': '10/min'
    }
}

CORS Configuration

# CORS settings
CORS_ALLOWED_ORIGINS = [
    "https://evmeri.vercel.app",
    "https://www.evmeri.com",
]

CORS_ALLOW_CREDENTIALS = True

CORS_ALLOWED_HEADERS = [
    'accept',
    'accept-encoding',
    'authorization',
    'content-type',
    'dnt',
    'origin',
    'user-agent',
    'x-csrftoken',
    'x-requested-with',
]

Mobile Security

Secure Storage

// Flutter secure storage
import 'package:flutter_secure_storage/flutter_secure_storage.dart';

class SecureStorageService {
  static const _storage = FlutterSecureStorage(
    aOptions: AndroidOptions(
      encryptedSharedPreferences: true,
    ),
    iOptions: IOSOptions(
      accessibility: IOSAccessibility.first_unlock_this_device,
    ),
  );

  static Future storeToken(String token) async {
    await _storage.write(key: 'auth_token', value: token);
  }

  static Future getToken() async {
    return await _storage.read(key: 'auth_token');
  }
}

Certificate Pinning

// HTTP client with certificate pinning
class SecureHttpClient {
  static HttpClient createSecureClient() {
    final client = HttpClient();
    client.badCertificateCallback = (cert, host, port) {
      // Implement certificate pinning logic
      return _validateCertificate(cert, host);
    };
    return client;
  }
}

Logging Configuration

# Django logging settings
LOGGING = {
    'version': 1,
    'disable_existing_loggers': False,
    'formatters': {
        'verbose': {
            'format': '{levelname} {asctime} {module} {process:d} {thread:d} {message}',
            'style': '{',
        },
    },
    'handlers': {
        'file': {
            'level': 'INFO',
            'class': 'logging.FileHandler',
            'filename': 'evmeri.log',
            'formatter': 'verbose',
        },
        'console': {
            'level': 'DEBUG',
            'class': 'logging.StreamHandler',
            'formatter': 'verbose',
        },
    },
    'root': {
        'handlers': ['console', 'file'],
        'level': 'INFO',
    },
}

Business Analytics

Key Metrics

  • User Metrics: Registration, retention, engagement
  • Station Metrics: Usage, availability, ratings
  • Payment Metrics: Transaction volume, success rates
  • Performance Metrics: App performance, API response times

Analytics Implementation

// Firebase Analytics (Mobile)
class AnalyticsService {
  static FirebaseAnalytics analytics = FirebaseAnalytics.instance;

  static Future logEvent(String name, Map parameters) async {
    await analytics.logEvent(
      name: name,
      parameters: parameters,
    );
  }

  static Future logStationView(String stationId) async {
    await logEvent('station_view', {
      'station_id': stationId,
      'timestamp': DateTime.now().millisecondsSinceEpoch,
    });
  }

  static Future logChargingSession(String sessionId, double amount) async {
    await logEvent('charging_session_start', {
      'session_id': sessionId,
      'amount': amount,
    });
  }
}

Performance Monitoring

Database Monitoring

# Database query optimization
class OptimizedStationViewSet(viewsets.ModelViewSet):
    queryset = ChargingStation.objects.select_related('owner').prefetch_related(
        'connectors', 'amenities', 'reviews'
    )

    def get_queryset(self):
        queryset = super().get_queryset()

        # Add distance annotation for nearby queries
        lat = self.request.query_params.get('lat')
        lng = self.request.query_params.get('lng')

        if lat and lng:
            user_location = Point(float(lng), float(lat), srid=4326)
            queryset = queryset.annotate(
                distance=Distance('location', user_location)
            ).order_by('distance')

        return queryset

API Performance

# Custom middleware for API monitoring
class APIMonitoringMiddleware:
    def __init__(self, get_response):
        self.get_response = get_response

    def __call__(self, request):
        start_time = time.time()

        response = self.get_response(request)

        duration = time.time() - start_time

        # Log API performance
        logger.info(f"API {request.path} - {response.status_code} - {duration:.3f}s")

        # Send metrics to monitoring service
        if duration > 1.0:  # Log slow requests
            logger.warning(f"Slow API request: {request.path} took {duration:.3f}s")

        return response

❓ 14. FAQ & Troubleshooting

Frequently Asked Questions

General Questions

Q: What is evmeri?

A: evmeri is Ethiopia's premier electric vehicle charging network platform that helps EV owners find, navigate to, and pay for charging sessions at stations across the country.

Q: Is evmeri free to use?

A: Yes, the basic evmeri app is free to download and use. You only pay for the actual charging sessions at stations.

Q: Which vehicles are supported?

A: evmeri supports all electric vehicles with standard charging connectors including Type 2, CCS, CHAdeMO, and Tesla connectors.

Technical Questions

Q: How do I report a bug?

A: You can report bugs through the app's "Report Issue" feature or by emailing our support team at support@evmeri.com.

Q: Can I use evmeri offline?

A: Limited functionality is available offline, including cached maps and recently viewed station information. However, real-time data requires an internet connection.

Q: How accurate is the station availability information?

A: Station availability is updated in real-time. However, there may be a slight delay (1-2 minutes) between actual status changes and app updates.

Common Issues & Solutions

App Issues

Issue: App crashes on startup

  • Solution: Clear app cache and restart
  • Update to the latest app version
  • Restart your device
  • Reinstall the app if problem persists

Issue: Map not loading

  • Check internet connection
  • Enable location services
  • Clear app cache
  • Try switching between WiFi and mobile data

Issue: GPS location inaccurate

  • Ensure location services are enabled
  • Use the app outdoors for better GPS signal
  • Restart location services
  • Check for device software updates

Payment Issues

Issue: Payment failed

  • Verify payment method details
  • Check account balance
  • Ensure stable internet connection
  • Try alternative payment method
  • Contact support if issue persists

Issue: Charging session won't start

  • Verify payment was successful
  • Check connector compatibility
  • Ensure connector is properly inserted
  • Try restarting the session
  • Contact station support

Account Issues

Issue: Can't log in

  • Verify email and password
  • Check if account is verified
  • Use "Forgot Password" if needed
  • Clear app cache
  • Contact support for account issues

Performance Optimization

Mobile App Performance

  • Close unused apps: Free up device memory
  • Update regularly: Keep app updated for best performance
  • Clear cache: Regularly clear app cache
  • Restart device: Periodic device restarts help performance

Network Optimization

  • Use WiFi when available: Faster and more stable connection
  • Check signal strength: Move to areas with better signal
  • Disable VPN: VPNs can slow down connections
  • Close background apps: Reduce network usage

Getting Help

Support Channels

  • In-App Support: Use "Help & Support" in app settings
  • Email Support: support@evmeri.com
  • Phone Support: +251-11-XXX-XXXX (Business hours)
  • Live Chat: Available on website during business hours
  • Community Forum: community.evmeri.com

Emergency Support

  • 24/7 Emergency Line: +251-11-XXX-XXXX
  • Emergency Features: Use emergency button in app
  • Station Emergency: Contact station operator directly

🤝 15. Contributing Guide

Getting Started

Prerequisites

  • Git knowledge and GitHub account
  • Development environment setup (see Installation section)
  • Understanding of our tech stack
  • Familiarity with our coding standards

Development Workflow

  1. Fork the Repository: Create your own fork of the project
  2. Create Feature Branch: git checkout -b feature/your-feature-name
  3. Make Changes: Implement your feature or fix
  4. Write Tests: Add tests for your changes
  5. Run Tests: Ensure all tests pass
  6. Commit Changes: Use conventional commit messages
  7. Push Branch: Push to your fork
  8. Create Pull Request: Submit PR for review

Coding Standards

Python/Django Standards

# Follow PEP 8 style guide
# Use Black for code formatting
black --line-length 88 .

# Use isort for import sorting
isort .

# Use flake8 for linting
flake8 --max-line-length 88 --extend-ignore E203,W503

# Example function documentation
def calculate_distance(lat1: float, lng1: float, lat2: float, lng2: float) -> float:
    """
    Calculate distance between two points using Haversine formula.

    Args:
        lat1: Latitude of first point
        lng1: Longitude of first point
        lat2: Latitude of second point
        lng2: Longitude of second point

    Returns:
        Distance in kilometers
    """
    # Implementation here
    pass

Flutter/Dart Standards

// Follow Dart style guide
// Use dartfmt for formatting
dart format .

// Use dart analyze for linting
dart analyze

// Example class documentation
/// Service class for handling authentication operations.
///
/// This class provides methods for user login, registration,
/// and token management.
class AuthService {
  /// Logs in a user with email and password.
  ///
  /// Returns [User] object on success, null on failure.
  static Future login(String email, String password) async {
    // Implementation here
  }
}

React/JavaScript Standards

// Use ESLint and Prettier
// Follow Airbnb style guide

// Example component documentation
/**
 * StationCard component displays charging station information
 * @param {Object} station - Station object with details
 * @param {Function} onNavigate - Callback for navigation
 * @returns {JSX.Element} Rendered station card
 */
const StationCard = ({ station, onNavigate }) => {
  // Implementation here
};

Commit Guidelines

Conventional Commits

# Format: type(scope): description

# Types:
feat: new feature
fix: bug fix
docs: documentation changes
style: formatting changes
refactor: code refactoring
test: adding tests
chore: maintenance tasks

# Examples:
feat(auth): add two-factor authentication
fix(payment): resolve Chapa integration issue
docs(api): update endpoint documentation
test(stations): add unit tests for station service

Pull Request Process

PR Requirements

  • Clear Description: Explain what changes were made and why
  • Tests Included: Add tests for new features and bug fixes
  • Documentation Updated: Update relevant documentation
  • Code Review: Address all review comments
  • CI Passing: All automated checks must pass

PR Template

## Description
Brief description of changes

## Type of Change
- [ ] Bug fix
- [ ] New feature
- [ ] Breaking change
- [ ] Documentation update

## Testing
- [ ] Unit tests added/updated
- [ ] Integration tests added/updated
- [ ] Manual testing completed

## Checklist
- [ ] Code follows style guidelines
- [ ] Self-review completed
- [ ] Documentation updated
- [ ] Tests pass locally

Issue Reporting

Bug Reports

  • Clear Title: Descriptive issue title
  • Steps to Reproduce: Detailed reproduction steps
  • Expected Behavior: What should happen
  • Actual Behavior: What actually happens
  • Environment: Device, OS, app version
  • Screenshots: Visual evidence if applicable

Feature Requests

  • Problem Statement: What problem does this solve?
  • Proposed Solution: How should it work?
  • Alternatives: Other possible solutions
  • Use Cases: Who would benefit?
  • Priority: How important is this feature?
